message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.AI, cs.IR 

This paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category as it introduces a new video dataset for spatio-temporally localized atomic visual actions and presents a novel approach for action localization. It may also belong to the machine learning (cs.LG) sub-category as the approach for action localization builds upon the current state-of-the-art methods. The use of movies to gather a varied set of action representations suggests that it may also belong to the multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category. The need for developing new approaches for video understanding indicates that it may belong to the artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. Finally, the precise spatio-temporal annotations and exhaustive annotation of atomic actions suggest that it may also belong to the information retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category.
